CatDescriptText: Anna K. Comer, 3074 Zaruba Street, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, July 12, 1958, pg. 2 with question: "Should well-defined courses in sex education be taught in public school system? If so, at what grade should the teaching of these courses begin?" answer reads: "Yes, and I think that it would be wise to begin the courses whenever the children begin asking questions, regardless of what age they are.  This instruction should be in words and language which they understand."
TitMainTitle: Anna K. Comer wearing light colored sleeveless dress with dark seaming, standing on in front of light colored stone flecked wall with Mellon Bank sign, store window on left with female mannequin, men walking on sidewalk on right
